chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: The burden which Habakkuk the prophet did see.
items.plainText: The burden which Habakkuk the prophet did see.

items.text: O LORD, how long shall I cry, and thou wilt not hear! even cry out unto thee of violence, and thou wilt not save!
items.plainText: O LORD, how long shall I cry, and thou wilt not hear! even cry out unto thee of violence, and thou wilt not save!

items.text: Why dost thou shew me iniquity, and cause me to behold grievance? for spoiling and violence are before me: and there are that raise up strife and contention.
items.plainText: Why dost thou shew me iniquity, and cause me to behold grievance? for spoiling and violence are before me: and there are that raise up strife and contention.

items.text: Therefore the law is slacked, and judgment doth never go forth: for the wicked doth compass about the righteous; therefore wrong judgment proceedeth.
items.plainText: Therefore the law is slacked, and judgment doth never go forth: for the wicked doth compass about the righteous; therefore wrong judgment proceedeth.

items.text: Behold ye among the heathen, and regard, and wonder marvellously: for I will work a work in your days, which ye will not believe, though it be told you.
items.plainText: Behold ye among the heathen, and regard, and wonder marvellously: for I will work a work in your days, which ye will not believe, though it be told you.

items.text: For, lo, I raise up the Chaldeans, that bitter and hasty nation, which shall march through the breadth of the land, to possess the dwellingplaces that are not theirs.
items.plainText: For, lo, I raise up the Chaldeans, that bitter and hasty nation, which shall march through the breadth of the land, to possess the dwellingplaces that are not theirs.

items.text: They are terrible and dreadful: their judgment and their dignity shall proceed of themselves.
items.plainText: They are terrible and dreadful: their judgment and their dignity shall proceed of themselves.

items.text: Their horses also are swifter than the leopards, and are more fierce than the evening wolves: and their horsemen shall spread themselves, and their horsemen shall come from far; they shall fly as the eagle that hasteth to eat.
items.plainText: Their horses also are swifter than the leopards, and are more fierce than the evening wolves: and their horsemen shall spread themselves, and their horsemen shall come from far; they shall fly as the eagle that hasteth to eat.

items.text: They shall come all for violence: their faces shall sup up as the east wind, and they shall gather the captivity as the sand.
items.plainText: They shall come all for violence: their faces shall sup up as the east wind, and they shall gather the captivity as the sand.

items.text: And they shall scoff at the kings, and the princes shall be a scorn unto them: they shall deride every strong hold; for they shall heap dust, and take it.
items.plainText: And they shall scoff at the kings, and the princes shall be a scorn unto them: they shall deride every strong hold; for they shall heap dust, and take it.

items.text: Then shall his mind change, and he shall pass over, and offend, imputing this his power unto his god.
items.plainText: Then shall his mind change, and he shall pass over, and offend, imputing this his power unto his god.

items.text: Art thou not from everlasting, O LORD my God, mine Holy One? we shall not die. O LORD, thou hast ordained them for judgment; and, O mighty God, thou hast established them for correction.
items.plainText: Art thou not from everlasting, O LORD my God, mine Holy One? we shall not die. O LORD, thou hast ordained them for judgment; and, O mighty God, thou hast established them for correction.

items.text: Thou art of purer eyes than to behold evil, and canst not look on iniquity: wherefore lookest thou upon them that deal treacherously, and holdest thy tongue when the wicked devoureth the man that is more righteous than he?
items.plainText: Thou art of purer eyes than to behold evil, and canst not look on iniquity: wherefore lookest thou upon them that deal treacherously, and holdest thy tongue when the wicked devoureth the man that is more righteous than he?

items.text: And makest men as the fishes of the sea, as the creeping things, that have no ruler over them?
items.plainText: And makest men as the fishes of the sea, as the creeping things, that have no ruler over them?

items.text: They take up all of them with the angle, they catch them in their net, and gather them in their drag: therefore they rejoice and are glad.
items.plainText: They take up all of them with the angle, they catch them in their net, and gather them in their drag: therefore they rejoice and are glad.

items.text: Therefore they sacrifice unto their net, and burn incense unto their drag; because by them their portion is fat, and their meat plenteous.
items.plainText: Therefore they sacrifice unto their net, and burn incense unto their drag; because by them their portion is fat, and their meat plenteous.

items.text: Shall they therefore empty their net, and not spare continually to slay the nations?
items.plainText: Shall they therefore empty their net, and not spare continually to slay the nations?
